learnings.details:
**Tool:** {"items":[{"paper_title":"Evaluating the Impact of Continuing Medical Education in the Interdisciplinary Team: A Novel, Targeted Approach","abstract":"ABSTRACT In order to maximise the learning potential of medical education programmes aimed at interdisciplinary or multidisciplinary teams, it is important to understand how the effectiveness of these programmes can vary between healthcare professionals from different specialities. In this analysis, we report on a new approach to measuring change in knowledge and competence among learners from different physician specialities. 
 
 
 
 The aim of the study was to determine the scope of published scientific literature on the training of undergraduate medical students in “general medical practice” and “primary health care,” exploring how these two concepts are understood, the pedagogical approaches employed by the trainers, the training platforms and the challenges encountered during the training
